meanings.sent1: Wearing a helmet is obligato when riding a bike.
meanings.sent2: Studying is obligato before taking a test.
meanings.sent3: It is obligato to brush your teeth every morning.
meanings.sent4: Patience is obligato when dealing with children.
meanings.sent5: Water is obligato for our survival.

meanings.definition: A musical term indicating that a certain part must be played or sung
meanings.sent1: The violinist performed the obligato beautifully.
meanings.sent2: The pianist added an obligato to the melody.
meanings.sent3: The obligato in the song made everyone dance.
meanings.sent4: The obligato soared above the rest of the music.
meanings.sent5: The obligato added depth to the musical piece.

meanings.sent1: It is my obligato to take care of my pet.
meanings.sent2: She fulfilled her obligato as a team leader.
meanings.sent3: His obligato is to make sure everyone is safe.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's obligato is to educate the students.
meanings.sent5: Being honest is an obligato in this family.
